metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27515 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
url-parse before 1.5.0 mishandles certain uses of backslash such as http:\/and interprets the URI as a relative path.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-27515` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-url-parse - 1.5.9+~1.4.8-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: node-url-parse package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.9+~1.4.8-1').
